toy.portion_note: Small frequent meals to avoid hypoglycemia

medium.portion_note: Balanced meals with appropriate protein-fat ratio

large.portion_note: Controlled portions to prevent obesity; joint-support supplements recommended

giant.portion_note: Slow-feeder bowls recommended; avoid exercise after meals to prevent bloat

Affenpinscher.diet_tips: High-quality small-breed kibble. Prone to dental issues, include dental chews.
Affenpinscher.health_notes: Prone to patellar luxation; maintain lean weight.

Afghan_hound.diet_tips: High-protein diet for lean athletic build. Needs quality fats for coat health.
Afghan_hound.health_notes: Deep-chested; feed smaller meals to prevent bloat. Sensitive stomach.

Airedale_terrier.diet_tips: Active breed needs protein-rich diet. Moderate fat for energy.
Airedale_terrier.health_notes: Prone to hip dysplasia; keep weight controlled.

Akita.diet_tips: Rice-based diet suits well due to Japanese heritage. High-protein, moderate fat.
Akita.health_notes: Prone to hypothyroidism and bloat. Monitor portion sizes carefully.

Alaskan_malamute.diet_tips: High-protein, high-fat diet for energy. Reduce calories in warm weather.
Alaskan_malamute.health_notes: Prone to obesity if under-exercised. Monitor weight closely.

Australian_shepherd.diet_tips: Very active breed needs calorie-dense, high-protein food.
Australian_shepherd.health_notes: High energy needs; adjust portions based on activity level.

Beagle.diet_tips: Prone to overeating; strict portion control essential. High-fiber diet helps.
Beagle.health_notes: Very food-motivated; use puzzle feeders. Watch for obesity.

Bernese_mountain_dog.diet_tips: Large breed formula with controlled calcium for joint health.
Bernese_mountain_dog.health_notes: Prone to bloat and joint issues. Slow feeder recommended.

Border_collie.diet_tips: Extremely active; needs high-calorie, protein-rich food.
Border_collie.health_notes: Adjust food based on activity. Working dogs need 20-30% more calories.

Boxer.diet_tips: Sensitive stomach; grain-free or limited ingredient diet often best.
Boxer.health_notes: Prone to allergies and bloat. Feed 2 smaller meals.

Bulldog.diet_tips: Prone to obesity; low-calorie, high-fiber diet. Avoid overfeeding.
Bulldog.health_notes: Brachycephalic - use wide shallow bowls. Prone to allergies.

Cavalier_king_charles_spaniel.diet_tips: Heart-healthy diet with taurine. Moderate portions.
Cavalier_king_charles_spaniel.health_notes: Prone to heart disease (MVD). Low-sodium diet important.

Chihuahua.diet_tips: Tiny stomach; needs calorie-dense, small-kibble food. Frequent small meals.
Chihuahua.health_notes: Prone to hypoglycemia; never skip meals. Dental care important.

Dachshund.diet_tips: Weight management critical due to long back. Low-calorie, high-fiber.
Dachshund.health_notes: Obesity causes severe back problems (IVDD). Keep very lean.

Dalmatian.diet_tips: UNIQUE: Low-purine diet essential. Avoid organ meats and high-purine proteins.
Dalmatian.health_notes: Prone to urinary stones. Ensure ample fresh water intake.

Doberman_pinscher.diet_tips: High-protein for lean muscle. Heart-healthy diet with taurine.
Doberman_pinscher.health_notes: Prone to DCM (heart disease). Taurine supplementation important.

French_bulldog.diet_tips: Prone to allergies; limited ingredient or novel protein diets work best.
French_bulldog.health_notes: Brachycephalic - slow feeder bowls. Prone to obesity and gas.

German_shepherd_dog.diet_tips: High-protein diet for muscle. Sensitive stomach common.
German_shepherd_dog.health_notes: Prone to EPI and hip dysplasia. Digestive health is key.

Golden_retriever.diet_tips: Prone to obesity; measure portions carefully. High-quality protein essential.

Great_dane.diet_tips: Giant breed formula with controlled growth rate. NEVER over-supplement calcium.
Great_dane.health_notes: Very prone to bloat. Feed 2-3 smaller meals. No exercise 1hr after eating.

Husky.diet_tips: Surprisingly efficient metabolism; needs less food than expected for size.
Husky.health_notes: May self-regulate eating. Increase food in cold weather/high activity.

Labrador_retriever.diet_tips: VERY prone to obesity (POMC gene). Strict portion control is critical.
Labrador_retriever.health_notes: Always hungry due to genetics. Use puzzle feeders and slow-feeder bowls.

Maltese.diet_tips: Small-breed formula. Prone to picky eating; consistent schedule important.
Maltese.health_notes: Prone to tear staining; diet can affect this. Dental care important.

Poodle.diet_tips: High-quality protein for muscle and coat. Varies by size (toy/mini/standard).
Poodle.health_notes: Prone to bloat (standard). Skin sensitivities common.

Rottweiler.diet_tips: Large breed formula with joint support. High protein, moderate fat.
Rottweiler.health_notes: Prone to obesity and joint problems. Maintain lean body weight.

Saint_bernard.diet_tips: Giant breed formula. Slow controlled growth for puppies. Bloat prevention.
Saint_bernard.health_notes: Very prone to bloat and joint issues. Feed 2-3 smaller meals on raised bowls.

Shih_tzu.diet_tips: Small breed formula. Prone to dental issues; kibble size matters.
Shih_tzu.health_notes: Brachycephalic; use flat bowls. Monitor weight carefully.

Yorkshire_terrier.diet_tips: Tiny breed; calorie-dense small kibble. Frequent meals to prevent hypoglycemia.
Yorkshire_terrier.health_notes: Prone to liver shunts and dental disease. High-quality protein essential.

puppy.notes: Higher protein and fat for growth. DHA for brain development. Puppy-specific formula.

young_adult.notes: Transition to adult food. Maintain high activity diet.

adult.notes: Maintenance diet. Monitor weight and adjust portions.

senior.notes: Reduced calories, increased fiber. Joint support becomes important.

geriatric.notes: Senior formula. Easy-to-digest food. Monitor kidney and liver health.

underweight.notes: Gradually increase calories by 10-20%. Check for underlying health issues.

ideal.notes: Maintain current diet. Monitor with regular weigh-ins.

overweight.notes: Reduce calories by 15%. Increase exercise gradually. Switch to weight management food.

obese.notes: Consult vet for weight loss plan. Reduce calories by 30%. Slow gradual weight loss.
